docs.lead_paragraph: ON the evening of June 10, 1935, a New York stockbroker visited a surgeon in a suburb of Akron, Ohio. Both men were confirmed and "hopeless" drunks. In despair and loneliness, they almost inadvertently made a major medical and social discovery.

headline.main: Anonymous Struggle for 25 Years; The growth of Alcoholics Anonymous, founded a quarter-century ago this month, has spurred new efforts to control a major national health problem. Anonymous Struggle for 25 Years

docs.abstract: Dr H J Geiger article on history and methods; illus
docs.snippet: ON the evening of June 10, 1935, a New York stockbroker visited a surgeon in a suburb of Akron, Ohio. Both men were confirmed and "hopeless" drunks. In despair and loneliness, they almost inadvertently made a major medical and social discovery.
